Photo via Unsplash

This Week in Genesis we’ll have you roaring with excitement with the release of Genesis 2.5, another Genesis theme gets WooCommerce 3.0 support, and the imminent return of a podcast favourite.

Genesis 2.5

Genesis lead developer, Nathan Rice, reveals that Genesis 2.5 is now available.

Nathan describes 2.5 as making:

significant progress, both in conversation and code, in starting to move Genesis into a better-organized, more object-oriented direction.

Highlights include:

  • breaking up larger blocks of HTML into separate views
  • further improvements to the Markup API
  • extracting more of the legacy XHTML logic to a separate file
  • full support for the new WordPress title tag

For the full changelog and more details, check out Nathan’s blog post.

Genesis 2.5 Now Available — https://t.co/tzI3GHPmCD #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/urAwcMkxl5

— StudioPress (@studiopress) April 26, 2017

Huge thanks, as always, to the tireless leads and contributors.

Genesis 2.5 just released and I'm proud to be part of the group that helped. FYI, my notes on why I like #GenesisWP https://t.co/CUVO2S2KSP pic.twitter.com/IL3d97Cf5q

— Sal Ferrarello (@salcode) April 26, 2017

And, as you might expect, the feedback’s been great so far.

Saw #GenesisWP v2.5 update. I ripped through some code quickly; have to say… I like to see the codebase moving in the right direction.

— Chuck Reynolds 🌐 (@ChuckReynolds) April 27, 2017

Themes

Wes Straham makes some WooCommerce 3.0 compatibility improvements and more to his popular Aspire Pro theme.

(And yes, that’s on StudioPress so you can go grab it straight away if you’re a Pro Plus (All Themes) member).

'Aspire Pro' v1.2 is now available! https://t.co/85K3PVoP9Y

Improvements made for #WooCommerce 3.0+ and much more!#genesiswp #wordpress pic.twitter.com/qYiUx1woAE

— Wes Straham (@WesStraham) April 28, 2017

Podcasts & Live Shows

Rethink FM is back! And the first episode of the new season promises to be a great one – and particularly with the release of Genesis 2.5 this week – with Gary Jones on the show talking to host Jackie D’Elia.

Woot! Season 2 starts next week – first up is @garyj and we are talking coding standards, Genesis and what’s ahead. #genesiswp

— Rethink FM (@rethinkfm) April 28, 2017

Brian Gardner chats Genesis 2.5 and more on his latest Facebook Live episode.

Join @bgardner right now live on Facebook. Ask him anything —> https://t.co/orgsCqbfck #genesiswp pic.twitter.com/gDz8TdaW6d

— StudioPress (@studiopress) April 27, 2017

Showcase

Sara Dunn with a really good use of Maker Pro for her agency site, 11web.com

Update launched to the @11Web website! Built on @studiopress Maker Pro + #GenesisWP. The cobbler's children finally have dang some shoes. pic.twitter.com/Uh1C0R0g6v

— Sara Dunn (@Sara11D) April 26, 2017

Nice, simple execution of Utility Pro from Quincy Zikmund for elbertsnaturalfoods.com

I recently launched a new site for one of my favorite local businesses with #genesiswp and Utility Pro. https://t.co/cbv1MP4cnQ

— Quincy Zikmund (@quincyzikmund) April 28, 2017

Best of the rest

Elizabeth Jamieson shows you how to build a sales page with Genesis.

Case Study – Minima Designs Inspired Sales Page

Sridhar Katakam on how to filter posts by category using FacetWP in Genesis. (I’ve been using FacetWP a lot recently and it’s a really solid, easy to use plugin).

How to Filter Posts by Categories using @FacetWP in Genesis:https://t.co/0lX0I8KMxA#GenesisWP pic.twitter.com/2zzm8HNmvX

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) April 26, 2017

In the UK and want to meet other Genesis folk? Fill out this meetup survey.

Do you want to meet other UK based #genesiswp folk? We’re organising a meet up. Have your say on date & location https://t.co/qIWTkCPLhK

— UK Genesis (@UKGenesis) April 27, 2017

Chris Mcintosh, creator of the Bolt Pro starter theme for Genesis, wants to know: what’s important for you in a Genesis starter theme?

What is important to you in a #genesiswp starter theme?

— Chris Mcintosh (@akamac) April 24, 2017
